greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = P_n(-1), where P_n(x) is a certain polynomial arising in the enumeration of tatami mat coverings.
comment: See Erickson-Ruskey for precise definition. The polynomials P_n(x) are described as "mysterious".
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
A. Erickson and F. Ruskey, Enumerating maximal tatami mat coverings of square grids with v vertical dominoes, arXiv:1304.0070 [math.CO], 2013
mathematica: Rest[Rest[CoefficientList[Series[x^2*(1/Sqrt[1-4*x^2] - x/((1-2*x^2)*Sqrt[1-4*x^2])), {x, 0, 30}], x]]] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jun 14 2015, after _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_ *)

max = 30; Clear[g]; g[max + 2] = 1; g[k_] := g[k] = 1 - 2*x^2 - 2*x*(1 - 2*x^2)^2*(2*k+1)/( 2*x*(1 - 2*x^2)*(2*k+1) - (k+1)/(1 - x/g[k+1] )); gf = 1 - x/g[0]; CoefficientList[Series[gf, {x, 0, max}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jun 14 2015, after _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_ *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 06 2013
